developHeaderDescription: Create, edit, and manage your studies, tasks, and surveys here.
selectWhichToClone: Select which {{taskType}} you would like to clone below.
whatWouldYouLikeToDevelop: What would you like to develop?
studyDescription: A study is a research project with a research question. It can consist of multiple tasks and/or surveys.
taskDescription: In a task, participants are asked to perform specific actions (e.g., press a button) based on what they see or hear.
surveyDescription: In a survey, participants are asked questions about themselves, about how they behave, or about how they feel.
blockDescription: In a block, participants are presented with information.
buildStudyFromExisting: Build a study based on a pre-existing MindHive study
teacherExplicitInstruction: (only select this option if your teacher explicitly told you to do so)
createStudyWithoutProject: Create a study without a project
buildTaskFromExisting: Build a task based on a pre-existing MindHive task.
duplicateEditSurvey: Duplicate and edit a pre-existing MindHive survey and its parameters.
uploadTaskScript: Select this option if you would prefer to upload your own task script from lab.js.
uploadSurveyScript: Select this option if you would prefer to upload your own survey script from lab.js.
addExternalWithLink: Add an external {{develop}} with a web link
addExternalLinkInstruction: Select this option if you would prefer to add an external link
duplicateEditBlock: Duplicate and edit a pre-existing MindHive block and its parameters.
buildBlockFromScratch: Select this option if you would prefer to build a block entirely from scratch.
title: Title
descriptionDevelopHelp: This is visible to researchers, teachers, and students when choosing tasks or surveys in the Develop mode.
descriptionDiscoverHelp: This is visible to all platform users when choosing tasks or surveys in the Discover mode.
externalDataWarning: The data will not be saved to the MH database
durationHelp: Approximately how long will it take for someone to complete the {{taskType}}?
descriptionBeforeHelp: This is what participants will see before taking the {{taskType}}.
descriptionAfterHelp: This is what participants will see after taking the {{taskType}}.
backgroundHelp: Use this field to provide some brief background on the topic of research. What is the problem under study and why is it important?
formatSurveyHelp: For example: 10 questions in a 5-point Likert scale format. Questions fall into 2 categories (negative and positive affect). 4 of the questions are reverse-scored.
descriptionBeforeVisible: This is visible to anyone who hasn't yet participated in the task.
descriptionAfterVisible: This is visible to anyone who has participated in the task.
unsavedChangesWarning: Your unsaved changes will be lost. Click Cancel to return and save the changes.

actionCard.deleteCardConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this card? This action cannot be undone.

deleteProposal.title: Are you sure you want to delete this proposal?
deleteProposal.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this proposal? All sections and cards in this proposal will be deleted as well.

studyManager.viewCreateAssign: View, create, or assign studies for the student
studyManager.noStudyConnected: No study is currently connected to this project. Use the options below to assign or create a new study.
studyManager.notAssignedToAnyStudies: This student is not assigned to any studies as a collaborator.
studyManager.title: Title:
studyManager.selectDifferentStudy: Select a different study to connect to this project.
studyManager.chooseExistingStudy: Choose an existing study to assign to the project.
studyManager.createNewStudyToConnect: Create a new study to connect to this project.
studyManager.enterNewStudyName: Enter the name of the new study
studyManager.noProjectAssigned: No project is assigned. Please use the Project Manager to create or assign a project before managing studies.
studyManager.confirmStudyConnectionDesc: Are you sure you want to {{action}} this study to the project "{{project}}"? This action may affect related data.

proposalBoard.createYourStudyProposal: Create your study proposal here to begin your research journey

parameters.uploadLabjs: Please upload a lab.js json file first
parameters.noParameters: The template does not contain any parameters.
parameters.subtitle: Subtitle
parameters.askDataUsage: Ask students a data usage question after the task

template.title: Template title
template.uploadLabjs: Please upload a lab.js json file first
template.noParameters: The lab.js file does not contain any parameters.
template.selectType: Select the type of the parameter
template.instructions: Provide instructions for other users to understand what this parameter changes in the task
template.example: An example of what can be the parameter value
template.options: The options (each on a new line) for this parameter
template.defaultValue: The default value for this parameter

viewer.tweakableFeatures: The following features of this {{taskType}} can be tweaked:
viewer.defaultValues: Default values are shown (can clone {{taskType}} and modify these)
viewer.aggregateVariablesDesc: These data are automatically written to a csv file upon completion of the {{taskType}}

basicBlocks.title: Basic Blocks
basicBlocks.description: Want to include custom instructions to your participants or embed a link and/or video in your study's procedure? Select and edit a basic block

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: Want to measure a construct or variable by having participants complete an activity? Choose from this bank of validated tasks

surveys.title: Surveys
surveys.description: Want to measure participants' attitudes, experiences, or opinions through self-report? Choose from this bank of validated surveys
surveys.buildOwn: Cannot find a tools to measure one of you're study construct? Build your own with the Survey builder and teacher's help:

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Don't want to start from scratch? Select and edit a pre-made study design using one of the templates in this bank

description.title: Study description
description.internalUse: This is for internal use only. Participants won't see this description.

version.title: Study version
version.headerNote: Save different study designs displayed on the screen on the left
version.noVersionSaved: No study version has been saved yet. Create a new version by clicking on the button below.
version.name: Name
version.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the {{versionName}}?

builder.lockedMessage: This study has been submitted and cannot be edited. To make changes, please ask your teacher to un-submit the study.

main.noProjectFound: No project found, please save your project first.

byComponent.dataByTask: Data by task in separate files

participantInfo.englishQuestion: Do you understand basic instruction written in English?
participantInfo.agreedToSave: Agreed to save information for future studies

header.shareInstructions: Share the link below with your participants to invite them to join your study

collect.noProjectFound: No project found, please save your project first.
collect.noStudyAttachedHeader: ü§∑üèª Your project has no Study attached to it.
collect.noStudyAttachedMessage: Let your teacher know so they can create one and associate it. If you need help, please contact tech support at support.mindhive@nyu.edu.

notes.noNotes: No notes entered yet. Right-click to add notes.

connectModal.adminInfo: This information is visible only for ADMIN

connectStudyModal.adminInfo: This information is visible only for ADMIN
connectStudyModal.linkedProjectsDescription: Projects that share access to your study {{title}}

newProject.noTemplatesTitle: There are no project board templates in the class
newProject.noTemplatesSubtitle: To start a project, you need a project board template. Your teacher may not have a project board template linked to this class.
newProject.nameMessage: Give your project a name. This is not the study's title, but what you want to call your work space.
newProject.namePlaceholder: The name of my project is
newProject.alreadyAssociatedTitle: You already have a project associated with this class
newProject.alreadyAssociatedWarning: Do not proceed further unless you know what you are doing.

settingsBlock.acceptParticipantsDesc: Shows the 'Participate' button on the study page and allows visitors to participate in your study
settingsBlock.allowGuestParticipationDesc: Visitors can participate in your study as guests.
settingsBlock.askForConsentDesc: Visitors will be shown consent forms and will be asked to consent prior to participation
settingsBlock.onlyTeachersCanEditIRB: Only teachers, scientists, and administrators can add or edit IRB forms.
settingsBlock.askForZipDesc: Visitors will be asked to type in their zip code when joining the study
settingsBlock.autoLaunchDesc: Participants will be automatically taken to the first task after joining the study
settingsBlock.allowMultipleRetakesDesc: Allow participants to retake tasks or surveys multiple times
settingsBlock.emailNotificationsDesc: Show the email notifications prompt after each task/survey
settingsBlock.nycStudentsDesc: Ask participants whether they are students of a public school in NYC
settingsBlock.askForSonaId: Ask for participant's NYU SONA ID
settingsBlock.askForSonaIdDesc: Ask participants for NYU SONA ID
settingsBlock.onlyOver18Desc: Only allow participants over 18 to take part in this study
settingsBlock.connectExternalDevicesDesc: Shows the plugin for external devices during the task

share.tip: A tip - avoid spaces in the url. Use dashes instead, for example.

participantPageMain.noStudyHeader: ü§∑üèª Your project has no Study attached to it.
participantPageMain.noStudyMessage: Let your teacher know so they can create one and associate it. If you need help, please contact tech support at support.mindhive@nyu.edu.

title: Study Builder
description: The place to build a new study
build-intro: In this builder, you can create a new study, upload your own tasks, or use tasks from the library.
build-create-new-study: To create a new study, click the button below.

start.message: You can connect your study to a class now or later in the study settings.
